channel.title: Comments on: Finding Exact Duplicate Indexes
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.dc:creator: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.description: I just added a 4th column to the output for the code to drop the duplicate.
item.content:encoded: I just added a 4th column to the output for the code to drop the duplicate.

item.title: By: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.dc:creator: George Mastros (gmmastros)
item.description: Good suggestion David. I updated the query to include table name like you suggested.
item.content:encoded: Good suggestion David. I updated the query to include table name like you suggested.

item.title: By: David Forck (thirster42)
item.dc:creator: David Forck (thirster42)
item.description: Great query! You might add the table name that the indexes are on though so you don't have to go hunting if you've got funky indexe names
item.content:encoded: Great query! You might add the table name that the indexes are on though so you don’t have to go hunting if you’ve got funky indexe names

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Thanks, indicates 7 dups on one of our databases. Now all I have to do is find the people who created these.........
item.content:encoded: Thanks, indicates 7 dups on one of our databases. Now all I have to do is find the people who created these………
